Start: ^I stagger into the room with a yawn.

b: ^I don't feel particularly tired, but the snug comfort of my bed quickly convinces me otherwise.
^I barely make it onto the bed before sleep takes me.

Start: ^In what felt like a blink of an eye, night has vanished. Morning sunlight spills into the room.
^I look around and see Timothy by the side of my bed.
^[Timothy] "Oh! <jitter>Uh, sorry if I woke you up.</jitter>"
^[Timothy] "Oh! Um... well... you remember what I said yesterday about hanging out..."
^"I was kinda hoping you could... <size=50%>help me dye my hair."

s1: ^Even though I'm not surprised like I was the first time, I still play my part.

Start: ^[Timothy] "Ye-yeah. I've um... never done something like this, and I-I was wondering if I could get your help with it?"
^"I'll meet you in the common area when you're ready."
^Timothy slips out of the room with an innocent smile, leaving me to perform my morning ritual.
^It doesn't take me long and I catch up with him in no time.

s0: ^So, where is the stuff? Are we going to do this in our bathroom or the public restroom?

b: ^I ask despite knowing the answer already.

InTheCommons: ^"I was hoping you would know where we could get the stuff we need..."

Prescience: ^] "You're in luck. As it happens, I know exactly where to get some."
^] "If you want to prepare the bathroom, I'll be right back..."
^Using what I remember from last time, I manage to get the receipt and the hair dye box in less than ten minutes.
^Being stuck in a perpetual time loop has its moments, I guess.
^While doing things over and over again can get old, I don't think I'll ever get tired of this feeling.
PinkHairedExpert: ^I'm not sure why Timothy thought I'd be super knowledgeable about hair products.
^My only relevant experience was tie-dying a shirt in elementary school.
^[Timothy]"<jitter>Oh, no. I screwed up, didn't I?</jitter>"
^] "Oh, no, you're fine. I may not know much about this stuff, but I do know someone who does."
^I lead Timothy over to Eduardo's door.
^I knock loudly, then pause to listen. I'm about to knock again when I finally hear the tell-tale shuffling of someone moving to answer.
^, do you know what time it is?!"
^[Eduardo] "Oh, god, it's worse than I thought!"
^"What could you possibly need me for at..."

c: ^"I'm pretty sure Charlotte has been up for like... a couple hours already."

PinkHairedExpert: ^How has Max let you get away with sleeping in so much?

c: ^] "How has Max let you get away with sleeping in so much?"
^[Eduardo] "Oh, they've scolded me plenty. I just ignore them. They're not my mother."

g-0: ^] "Timothy wants to dye his hair. I was hoping we could borrow some of your supplies."
^A brief spark flashes in Eduardo's eyes behind his dreary expression.
^Eduardo moves to high five Timothy, who flinches and shrinks back.
^Shaking himself out of it, Timothy launches his own hand up to meet Eduardo's with a determined look.
^"But what makes ya think I got any hair dye products?"
^"I did have the stuff... A whole set of stuff, in fact."
^"I was actually just wondering where it went. It's about time I touched up my mane."
^"If you find it, I'd be happy to lend it to you guys! Just don't use up all the pink, yeah?"
^[Timothy] "Do you remember where you last saw it?"
^It's nice to see Timothy taking a more active role in the conversation.
^I think he's finally coming into his own.
^"I spend a lot of time in the art room with Isaac... but we also hang out in the commons all the time."
^"When I'm manic I tend to be all over the place, though, and of course it's possible someone has moved it."
^] "Thanks, anyway. We'll let you get back to sleep."
^[Timothy] "Don't worry, Eduardo. We're on the case!"
^I guess Timothy fancies us detectives now. I'll play along.
^Eduardo vanishes into the darkness behind him, yawning as the door clicks.

WantToDye: ^[Timothy] "Hmm... Seems like we should start with either the Art Room or the Commons."

s0: ^We arrive at the art room. Isaac is here sculpting something out of clay. He's so focused he doesn't seem to have noticed our arrival at all.
s1: ^We're back at the art room. Isaac's still here sculpting.

s0: ^Isaac is positioned in his usual spot, working on molding out... something, from his clay.
s1: ^ Isaac is still where we last saw him, slowly shaping...something, out of his clay mound.

b: ^a way to prove ownership of Eduardo's hair dye
^do you know where it is now
^[Isaac] "Was a nice day. Eduardo felt like it."
^] "Well Isaac, thanks for the info. See ya around!"
^] "Do you know where exactly in the gardens
^] "Well, uh, okay then. Catch you later."

Search: ^We look through all of the stored art projects, from paintings to sculptures.

s0: ^No hair dye materials, but a lot of neat little half finished sculptures.
s1: ^ Still nothing we were looking for, but we did find a few more neat little statuettes.
^I sh-should spend more time here l-later.

s0: ^Yeah, I'm not seeing it here. Guess we should try elsewhere.
s1: ^Yeah, that could be fun. But, we should keep going for now.

Search: ^We regroup at the front of the room.

s0: ^step into the cozy heart of Sunflower House.

s1: ^Trissa is still cooling off by the ping-pong table.

s0: ^Oh yeah! I am the Master! You better think twice next time you start talkin' a big game!
^The second-floor resident retreats into the hallway, shaking her head.
s1: ^There's no sign of her former opponent.

s0: ^Hey, y'all! Either of you down for a game?
^Sorry, no time. We're on a case!
^We're looking for Eduardo's lost hair dye. Timothy wants to dye his hair and Eduardo said we could use his stuff if we found it.
s1: ^Afraid not. Any other advice for us?

s0: ^I can't say I've seen it anywhere, no.
^But hey, you should ask Charlotte! That girl doesn't miss a thing!
^She's almost always in the library at this time.
s1: ^Stick with it and I know you'll find what you're lookin' for.

Search: ^We turn over couch cushions, peek under tables, and check every corner

s0: ^Me, neither. Guess we should move on.
s1: ^Oh, well. It was worth a shot.

Search: ^We regroup at the front of the room.

s0: ^When we step out into the garden, Timothy eagerly runs ahead. There's no one else here but us.
s1: ^Timothy seems happy to come back to the garden, perhaps especially because it's still empty.

s0: ^Timothy sets about searching the back of the garden while I take the front
s1: ^The two of us do a second sweep of the area

s0: ^I feel like I've turned over every last rock, plant, and clump of grass when I hear Timothy call out from by the bench.
s1: ^Now I really think I've turned over every rock. And nothing to show for it this time, unfortunately.

b: ^He hustles over to me, holding something in his left hand.
^"It looks like a receipt. And it's got a bunch of hair dye stuff on it!"
^He hands the receipt over to me. It's water-damaged in places and dirty everywhere else.
^I brush it off as best I can and look over the text.
^Sure enough, it looks like a receipt for hair dye.
^Now we can get Max to give us the dyes!
^But we still don't know where the dyes are...
^] "We're closing in on the end of our search, I can feel it."
^I pocket the receipt and look over the garden one more time.

Cafe: ^ the cafeteria. The sweet aroma of fresh fruit and frying meat fills my nostrils

s0: ^, reminding my stomach that I haven't eaten breakfast yet
^Max is leaning up against a wall, munching on a bagel.
s1: ^Having finished their bagel, Max is lethargically mopping under the counters.

b: ^"I gotta say, it's refreshing seein' you up and about this early!"
^ never gave me this much trouble about oversleeping.
^] "You can thank Timothy for that, really."
^[Timothy] "Heh. It's nothing... I-I just wanted to dye my hair..."
^] "Yeah... actually, we kinda need your help with that."
^[Max] "Oh? As much as I'd love to help, I'm actually really behind on cleaning..."
^[Timothy] "N-no, not like that. W-we need to find Eduardo's hair dye stuff."
^] "Charlotte said you might have stashed it in the supply closet."
^[Max] "Hmm... I don't remember puttin' any bottles in there, but... were they all in a box?"
^[Max] "You got me curious. Why don't we take a look!"
^Max strides casually over to the supply closet, slides a small silver key into the lock, and pulls the swing door open with a creak.
^"Feel free to have a look, but don't touch, guys!"
^Max returns to their spot in the corner and resumes work on their bagel.
^[Max] "Did you two find what you were looking for?"
^[Max] "Ah, well let me know when you have. I'm not supposed to leave the closet unlocked for very long, ya know."
^Max turns their attention back to their duties.

s0: ^Yeah! A b-box on the top shelf.
^Could you give it to us please?

b: ^It's a receipt for hair dye. I'm sure it matches the stuff in that box!
^Max takes the receipt from me and nods.

Objective: ^[Max] "I can't. I'm really sorry, gang, but Sunflower House has a policy of proof on all lost-and-found items."
^I know you want to use the hair dye, but unless you can provide some kind of proof of ownership I can't help you.

b: ^That makes sense, I guess. We'll try and find something like that, then.
^I'm sorry to have put you through all this.
^Just give me a moment to get it down for you.

GotItFirst: ^Max takes the receipt from me and looks it over.
GotIt: ^Max walks over to the supply closet and retrieves the box. They bring it back to us and plop it gently down on the table.
^[Max] "Have fun! Just try not to make too much of a mess, okay?"
^"I'm already behind on cleaning as it is!"
^"Can you meet me in the cafe at noon? There's some formal stuff I want to talk to you about."
^Right, the exit survey. I wonder if I'll ever actual take that thing.
^I wave to Max as we exit the cafe.
NoDice: ^Timothy and I give Max some space and plan our next move by the front of the cafe.

b: ^Timothy and I look over the items

s0: ^Beside the mundane kitchen supplies, various knick-knacks adorn the shelves
s1: ^The box marked `Hair Stuff` still seems the most likely culprit

s0: ^A case for what looks like a musical instrument with nothing inside, a bracelet of purple beads, and a worn poncho make up only a small number of these
s1: ^I wonder who the rest of this stuff belongs to. It can't all be Eduardo's

b: ^Timothy points to a box labeled `Hair Stuff` sitting on the top shelf.
^] "I dunno if I'll be able to reach it."
^[Timothy] "Yeah. And Max said not to touch anyway."

^We make for the supply closet Charlotte told us about.
^I remember seeing it when I would eat in the cafe, but I never knew it doubled as a lost-and-found.
^Probably because I don't have a lot of stuff...
^] "Yep. Let's see what we have here."
^I step forward to pull the door handle, but it won't budge.
^[Timothy] "Didn't Charlotte say that Max has the key?"

^I nod and turn back to face the cafe.
^I check the closet again, giving the handle a firm tug.
^No dice. Darn thing's locked up tight. We'll need to get the key from Max to open it.

s0: ^tending to her recommendations in the back corner
s1: ^reading on the sofa, having apparently finished with her recommendations

b: ^[Timothy] "Sh-should we get Charlotte's attention? I don't want to bother her, but Trissa said..."
^] "I hate bothering people, too. But we gotta do what we gotta do."

s0: ^Why, hello! It's quite rare that the library gets visitors at this time of day.
s1: ^Hello again! Is there something else I can assist you two with?

s0: ^Heh... We're, uh, not actually here for the library... We came to ask you some questions.
s1: ^What did you say we should do again?

b: ^[Charlotte] "Oh, my! Has there been a crime?"
^] "Nothing like that, no. Well... I guess Eduardo's hair dye could have been stolen..."
^[Charlotte] "Eduardo has lost his hair dye, has he? Why then, pray tell, are you two investigating it and not the troublemaker himself?"
^[Timothy] "B-because I want to... uh... use it... to... <size=60%>dye my hair<size=100%>."
^] "Trissa said you might have seen it."
^[Charlotte] "Ah. I see now. I would be happy to help resolve this for you..."
^"Alas, I have not seen Eduardo's dying materials."
^[Charlotte] "Don't despair yet, friend. I may not have seen the stuff, but I can certainly predict what has likely happened to it."
^"Eduardo has a long-standing habit of leaving his things strewn about the House."
^"I do not understand how Max has the patience to keep picking up after him, but I must applaud their patience."

^"Most such items are returned to Eduardo, but on occasion, when the man is unavailable or the items' owner inscrutable, Max locks them up in the storage closet in the cafeteria that acts as Sunflower House's `Lost and Found`."
^"I would wager said closet is currently home to many of Eduardo's possessions, including the object of your search."
^] "So you're saying we should go to the cafe?"
^[Charlotte] "I am indeed. However, the closet is kept locked, so you will need to entreat our lovable resident assistant for the key."
^"Conveniently, I just saw them heading to the cafe mere minutes ago."
^[Charlotte] "Perhaps you will be more likely to remember if I express myself more simply."
^"Eduardo's hair dye is probably locked in the cafe storage closet, but you need Max to unlock it for you to check."

Charlotte: ^Timothy and I leave Charlotte to her business and regroup at the front of the library.

^ the directions on the side of the bottle.

s0: ^I've never done this before, but how hard could it be?
s1: ^After almost botching it up last time, I'm careful to follow the directions more carefully this time.

TimeToDye: ^I shake the blue bottle as I direct Timothy where to sit.

s0: ^I start mixing the materials, but I put way too much color in and have to dilute it.

s0: ^We've got more than we need now, but Eduardo never uses blue anyway.

TimeToDye: ^] "So... it says it's going to sting a little,
^] "So, why did you want to dye you hair all of a sudden?"
^"I wanted to... do something to ex-express myself."
^"And I don't really like my hair color. It's just boring black, and I thought..."
^"Since I always get stressed out thinking about ex-expressing myself..."
^"With my hair a cool color, I can express myself and n-not think about it."
^"Out of sight, out of mind. Y-you know."
^"I did something like this b-before. @A long long time ago. @I... <size=80%>painted my nails once.<size=100%>"
^"I had to look at them too o-often, and I got self-conscious."
^He starts shivering. Alarmed, I stop applying the dye.
^] "It's okay Timothy. You're okay. You want me to stop? We can wash it out right now if you want."
^He stops shivering and takes a deep breath.
^Dying someones hair is actually a fairly time-consuming process and it's a few hours before we're done.
^"Okay Timothy, it should be good now, you can wash out your hair, and see what it looks like."
^[Timothy] "Okay. I kept waiting for it to sting real bad, but it never really did."
^"Though you might want to finish washing the dye out before you claim success. It's still wet and coming off in your hands."
^"It looks like you murdered a smurf."
^I leave Timothy to finish cleaning himself up and wait on my bed.
^"Y-you know, I was really scared coming here after Blackwell, but now... I'm really glad I did."
^"I-I know we've only known each other a few days... and you're leaving soon, b-but."
^I guess it really has been only a few days for him. I feel like I've known him for weeks at this point.
^"I-I really do think of you as a friend. I-I hope you do too."
^The moment is interrupted by a low growl from Timothy's stomach.
^[Dyed>Timothy] "I uh, guess I'm hungry. W-want to go grab something to eat?"
^] "In a bit. See you down there."
^Timothy practically skips out of the room. He's got more spring in his step than I've seen from him all week.
^I think he's going to be alright here.
